docs.snippet: Days after clashes in Charlottesville, Va., protesters toppled a statue of a Confederate soldier that had stood in front of the old Durham County Courthouse in North Carolina for nearly a century.

headline.main: Protesters Tear Down Confederate Statue in Durham

docs.snippet: As social media sites add more types of content, critics say it’s time they learn to better police what is posted.

headline.print_headline: Daily Report: Facebook Struggles With Being Responsible
headline.main: Daily Report: Facebook Struggles With Being Responsible

docs.snippet: The British publicist has a moment in the media glare as the broker of the 2016 meeting between Donald Trump Jr. and a Moscow insider.

headline.print_headline: A Trump Intermediary and Facebook Fan
headline.main: Rob Goldstone, Trump Intermediary, Likes Silly Hats and Facebook

docs.snippet: Facebook said it had erroneously blocked the account of Guo Wengui, who has accused the relatives of Chinese government officials of corruption.

headline.print_headline: Facebook Temporarily Suspends Account of an Outspoken Chinese Billionaire
headline.main: Facebook Briefly Suspends Account of Outspoken Chinese Billionaire

docs.snippet: Four lawyers are under review for social media posts that mocked people in Family Court in Queens.

headline.print_headline: Lawyers Under Scrutiny For Family Court Posts
headline.main: Lawyers for Child Welfare and Legal Aid Under Scrutiny for Facebook Posts

docs.snippet: Facebook’s chief executive introduced an augmented reality platform that will allow people to digitally manipulate the world around them.

headline.print_headline: New Gamble By Facebook: Augmented  Reality Apps
headline.main: Mark Zuckerberg Sees Augmented Reality Ecosystem in Facebook

docs.snippet: The social media network is struggling with its role in policing content on its global platform.

headline.print_headline: Video of Killing Casts Facebook In Harsh Light
headline.main: A Murder Posted on Facebook Prompts Outrage and Questions Over Responsibility

docs.snippet: Two days after Steve W. Stephens shot a stranger in Cleveland and posted a video of the crime online, he ended his life near Erie, Pa.

headline.print_headline: Hunt for Facebook Killer Ends With a McDonald’s Order and a Suicide
headline.main: Hunt for Facebook Killer Ends With McDonald’s Sighting and a Suicide

docs.snippet: The man suspected to be the gunman claimed to have killed other people, but the police said they knew of only one victim.

headline.print_headline: Cleveland Police Seek Suspect  After a Killing Seen on Facebook
headline.main: Cleveland Police Seek Suspect After a Killing Seen on Facebook

docs.snippet: The penalty is one of the largest fines against the social network and comes amid growing scrutiny of how the company gathers users’ information.

headline.print_headline: E.U. Fines Facebook $122 Million Over Disclosures in WhatsApp Deal
headline.main: E.U. Fines Facebook $122 Million Over Disclosures in WhatsApp Deal
